taxonomicName.authority: (H. F. Hance) D. J. Middleton & Mich. Moeller in Weber et al. (2011: 774)

paragraph.taxonomicName: Henckelia anachoreta (H.F. Hance) D.J. Middleton & Mich. Moeller in Weber et al. (2011: 774)

subSubSection.paragraph: ≡ Chirita anachoreta H.F. Hance (1866 : 231). Roettlera anachoreta (H.F. Hance) O. Kuntze (1891 : 476). Didymocarpus anachoretus (H.F. Hance) H. Lev . (1906: 427).
= Chirita minutiserrulata B. Hayata (1915 : 133). Didymocarpus minutiserrulatus (B. Hayata) Y. Yamamoto (1936 : 72). Type: China. Taiwan: Boho, July 1911, Inaba s.n. (TI, not seen).

= Didymostigma trichathera C.X. Ye & X.G. Shi (2005: 447), syn. nov. Type: China. Guangdong: Longmen County, Nankunshan National Forest Park, 17 August 2003, Chuang-Xing Ye 5960 (Holotype SYS; Isotype A-00135544!).
China. Guangdong: Qingyuan City, North River, 27 July 1864, F.H. Hance 11377 (Holotype BM-000041739!; Isotype K-000858355!).

Henckelia anachoreta
is a common species with a wide distribution in China (Guangdong, Guangxi, Hunan, Taiwan, Xizang, Yunnan), India (Sikkim), Laos, Myanmar, northern Thailand and northern Vietnam ( Weber et al. 2011 ). Plants often grow on moist rocks or ground surfaces in forest or near valley stream sides.
